Hamilton Health fosters a culture of patient and staff safety, whereby all employees are guided by our Mission, Vision, Values, and Values Based Code of Conduct. Hamilton Health Sciences is a teaching hospital and all staff and physicians are expected to support students and other learners.

To be considered for this opportunity applicants must apply during the posting period. All Internal applicants may apply online through the Careers website or by submitting a Competition Application Form. External applicants may ONLY apply via the Careers website.

Hamilton Health Sciences is an equal opportunity employer and we will accommodate any needs under the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedom, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities, if requested. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application processes, please contact the Human Resources Service Centre at 1-877-667-2700 for assistance. If the applicant requires a specific accommodation because of a disability during the interview, the applicant will need to advise the hiring manager when scheduling the interview and the appropriate accommodations can be made.

This competition is open to all qualified applicants, however, qualified internal applicants will be considered first. Past performance will be considered as part of the selection process. jobTitle: Specialist, T&S Project and Performance Support (Business Analytics)
jobDescription:
Permanent - Full Time
At SaskPower, we generate more than just electricity for Saskatchewan people. We offer some of the best jobs in the province.
Our challenging careers will help you grow while being surrounded by a fully-committed team, committed to safety, openness, collaboration and accountability. If you’re someone who thrives in a team environment and doesn’t shy away from a good challenge, join us!Apply no later than 12/07/2022 to be considered for this opportunity. JOB SUMMARY:The Specialist is accountable to provide subject matter expertise and administration of data analytics with SaskPower’s Technology and Security area. As a member of SaskPower’s management team, this position is responsible to act as a central point of contact in the management and administration of strategic and operational functions, providing expert advice and direction that aligns with departmental and corporate goals and objectives.This role is responsible for data analysis in support of measuring business performance. The role will develop metrics, KPIs and dashboards in support of SaskPower’s goals and objectives and in response to critical business questions. Where necessary the individual will add structure to the data, identify new required data points, and recommend realistic data collection methods. They will utilize the data to report, visualize, and ultimately tell the story of performance to various audiences and more importantly highlight recommended actions for improvement. The individual must effectively collaborate with stakeholders across SaskPower to deliver meaningful results.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:· Collect data from a variety of sources using existing methods and, where required, define new and sustainable collection techniques.· Define and manage metadata.· Create mechanisms for exploring structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data to identify patterns.· Assess data quality and support ongoing data integrity.· Generate insights and, where appropriate, recommendations from the available information.· Create reports in Microsoft Power BI (or similar if SaskPower toolset changes) and, where required, present insights and recommendations to leadership and stakeholders.· Commission and decommission datasets.· Handle confidential information responsibly and in accordance with applicable policy and procedures.· Train and transition ongoing reporting to appropriate team members.· Plan, research, develop, evaluate, and implement processes, policies and procedures utilized for the development of strategies and business initiatives that address the organization’s requirements· Act as a subject matter expert in data analytics to develop, implement, coach, and assist management staff in the administration and interpretation of corporate policies; providing advice that is appropriate, practical, and consistent with relevant legislation, regulations, laws and/or industry standards· Identify new business solutions and operational efficiencies, while providing recommendations which have a significant impact on SaskPower’s business operations and strategies· Lead and/or participate in cross-functional projects to provide data expertise for corporate and departmental strategic planning initiatives· Maintain knowledge of industry developments and best practices related to data analytics and adapt them to SaskPower’s operational environment· Provide leadership and direction to project teams and/or assigned staff as required
KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES: • Degree in Computer Science, Business Administration or other related equivalent AND/OR; • Related professional designation(s) and/or certification(s) AND/OR; • Five (5) years of related business analytics experience • Team player with the ability to build and maintain strategic relationships both internal and external to SaskPower • Results oriented thinker, with the ability to manage and provide advice regarding complex and confidential issues with sensitivity and professionalism • Excellent analytical, research and problem solving skills • Excellent oral and written communication skills • Ability to work and manage in a changing environment • Excellent facilitation, project management and decision making skills • Ability to foster a culture focused on safety, innovation and teamwork • Demonstrated skill in SaskPower’s competencies • Must have a continuing record of professional development 
A suitable combination of relevant education and experience may also be consideredCandidates under consideration may be required to participate in an assessment process consisting of any/all of the following: interview, abilities test, case study and/or presentation.SaskPower has identified competencies that enable performance and success within each out of scope role at SaskPower. For more information on these job family competencies and those that relate to the position that you are applying on, please visit: https://www.saskpower.com/Careers/Join-Our-Team/competencies
SaskPower offers a competitive salary and benefits package. Diversity and inclusion are also a priority for us. At SaskPower, we are committed to creating an inclusive workplace and having a workforce representative of the communities we serve. We are committed to selections based on merit and to the full participation of diversity groups. These groups include the four equity groups recognized by the Saskatchewan Human Rights Commission: Indigenous Peoples, Members of Visible Minority Groups / Racialized Groups, Persons with Disabilities and Women in Under-Represented Roles, as well as LGBTQ persons and Newcomers to Saskatchewan. Visit our website for details.
To learn more about SaskPower, check us out on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/PoweringthefutureKeep posted on the latest job openings on Twitter: www.twitter.com/saskpowerPlease apply by 12/07/2022.
companyDescription:
Since 1929, we've delivered power throughout our province. Today, we strive to serve an increasingly diverse and sophisticated customer base of over 540,000 customers. Our team of dedicated employees is made up of over 3,200 permanent full-time employees.
 
Our power assets:
 
We manage over $12 billion in total assets. Our company operates:

• three coal-fired power stations
• seven hydroelectric stations
• seven natural gas stations
• two wind facilities
 
Our power suppliers:
 
We also purchase power from the following producers:

• Red Lily Wind Energy Facility
• SunBridge Wind Energy Facility
• Western Lily Wind Energy Facility
• Morse Wind Energy Facility
• NRGreen Kerrobert, Loreburn, Estlin and Alameda Heat Recovery Facilities
• Spy Hill Generating Station
• North Battleford Generating Station
 
Our total available generation capacity is 4,993 MW
 
Our power network:

Our network serves a large geographic area and widely-dispersed population. We maintain more than 157,000 kilometres of power lines, 56 high voltage switching stations and 197 distribution substations. Our company also has interconnections at the Manitoba, Alberta and North Dakota borders.
 
*Information as of March 31, 2020

Job Description
Are you interested in building state of the art solutions that leverage Cloud Architecture and Artificial Intelligence (AI) as well as to have an impact in a fast-growing start up?
We are looking for experienced BI specialists with significant experience arranging datasets, extracting useful information, and visualizing them in meaningful dashboards to join our Software Delivery team. The candidate will work closely within a team environment to delivery high value solutions to our customers.
Your Role In The Team
 Arrange datasets and extract useful information to visualize it in meaningful dashboards.  Find relationships between various variables and time periods to enable executives in making the right business decisions.  Enable our customers to improve their ability to execute root cause analysis on low performing KPIs  Work closing with customers to define, document, and design meaningful KPIs and dashboards to improve business operational efficiency.  Provide data requirements and needs to the Delivery team.  Performs ad-hoc analyses of data stored in the business’s SQL databases and writes SQL scripts, analyzes data.  Troubleshoots data issues within the business and across the business, presents solutions to these issues.  Build KPIs and dashboards using ElasticSearch , Kibana, Tableau and/or PowerBI.  Participate with your teammates in sprints.  Be an advocate for quality throughout the delivery process. 
Skills & Qualifications
 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or in a related field or have equivalent experience.  Minimum 5 years hands on experience with SnowFlake, Elastic Search, Kibana, Grafana, Tableau and/or Power BI.  Knowledge of Informatica and ETL tools is an asset.  In-depth & strong knowledge of SQL language and query optimization.  Very good knowledge of BI principles (decision-making DWH, Data Marts, Data Lake).  Mindful of problem solving, initiative and innovation.  Written and spoken bilingualism (French and English).

jobTitle: Digital Analytics Implementation Specialist (Data Science) - Hybrid work
jobDescription:
Company Overview
The Globe and Mail is a national icon and Canada’s most recognized media brand.
We’re also an international award winner for data visualization, design, and creative storytelling. A digital innovator with a global client list for our in-house AI-powered optimization, prediction and automation platform. And a place where Canadians come for the best journalism in the country.
We aim to reflect Canada in the stories we tell and in our workforce. The Globe is a proud partner of Pride At Work, Canadian Centre for Diversity and Inclusion, and a signatory of the BlackNorth Initiative. We understand our staff have lives outside of the office and offer flexible work arrangements and support programs. We also provide training and mentorships to staff to ensure you’re able to grow and challenge yourself and your abilities.
No matter what your role at The Globe, you’ll be part of an organization dedicated to making a difference to Canada.
Position Overview
The Analytics team at The Globe and Mail is looking for a Digital Analytics Implementation Specialist with strong fundamental skills in using tag managers (GTM) and custom tagging, Javascript, HTML, QA and data wrangling. This person will be responsible for owning and implementing analytics tracking, and consequently ensuring data consistency and accuracy.
Responsibilities
 Support various teams with regards to analytics implementation, including deploying 3^rd party pixels, and defining analytics requirements  Ensure tracking is consistent, accurate, and useful for reporting on business KPIs  Manage analytics implementation documentation and current GTM properties  Become the subject matter expert for analytics implementation  Build and automate validation tests and reporting to facilitate internal data validation and improve QA efficiency  Assist in ensuring modelled data is accurate and reflective of business logic 
Must Have Qualifications
 Quantitatively focused bachelor’s degree preferred, with 3+ years of experience working with analytics implementation and QA  Experience with implementing analytics tracking on websites through Google Tag Manager or custom tracking  Knowledge of Java/Kotlin or Swift/Objective C  Knowledge of JavaScript with understanding of various browser rendering engines and ability to troubleshoot code in various browsers  Experience with iOS and Android SDKs for mobile platform analytics deployment  Testing experience including network debugging tools and HTTP Proxies  Strong communication skills and collaborative attitude  Proven ability to quickly and efficiently diagnose issues  Understanding of HTML, CSS and DOM  Knowledge of web analytics and inner workings of various web analytics tools (i.e. knowledge of beacons, data processing and enrichment)  Proficient with analytical (OLAP, HTAP, etc.) databases (Snowflake, BigQuery, etc.) and writing SQL queries to analyze and manipulate data  Understanding of software quality assurance practice and test methodologies 
Optional But Desirable Skills And Experience
 Experience with Tableau to build reports  Knowledge of version control systems, GIT preferred 
SALARY: Commensurate with qualifications and experience.
This is a Hybrid role, with remote and in-office work.
Vaccination Policy
All offers of employment with The Globe and Mail are conditional upon the candidate being Fully Vaccinated. To be Fully Vaccinated is defined as someone who has received the full series of a vaccine or a combination of vaccines accepted by the Government of Canada (currently Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca, Janssen) and has received the last dose at least 14 days prior to their start date. To prove they are Fully Vaccinated, all new hires will be required to provide evidence by emailing a copy of their vaccine dose administration receipt(s) to Human Resources prior to their start date. Those seeking exemption based on one or more of the protected grounds in the Human Rights Code will need to provide their request for accommodation to Human Resources for approval. If the accommodation request is not approved and the candidate is not Fully Vaccinated, any offer of employment will be revoked.
THE GLOBE AND MAIL IS DEDICATED TO DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION IN THE WORKPLACE   The Globe and Mail is committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment, where all employees feel valued, respected and supported. We believe this strengthens our business and our journalism. We welcome and encourage applications from individuals from all groups, regardless of race, ethnicity, culture, gender, sexual orientation, religion, socio-economic status, age, and physical ability. As required by the Federal Contractors Program, The Globe also tracks the proportion of staff in the four Employment Equity categories (Women, Aboriginal Peoples, Persons with Disabilities, and Members of Visible Minorities) to ensure we are reflecting the areas in which we work.
The Globe and Mail offers accommodation for applicants with disabilities as part of its recruitment process. If you are contacted to arrange for an interview, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

jobDescription:
Job Overview:

Reporting to the VP, Revenue Operations as the Data and Reporting Contractor, you ensure Modern Campus capitalizes on the benefits offered by having clean, reportable data that can be used to produce reliable analytics to drive decision making inside of Salesforce. In this role, you will streamline data, enhance data quality, clean/remove bad data, develop standard reports and dashboards in Salesforce/Tableau and provide general support to the Revenue Operations team.

You should possess knowledge of Salesforce and database management with the ability to work in a fast-paced, complex environment. You will work to ensure that your results translate into optimized data that can be easily and reliably report on and analyzed to support strategic decisions.

This is a full time 12-month contract position at a rate of $30/hour.

Responsibilities:
Assist with reviewing, assessing, and updating data as requiredReview historical data, reconcile, and provide recommendations for data cleanupProvide support for correcting data in an ad hoc manner to meet immediate requirementsFollow up with team to ensure data quality and accuracy through process adherenceAssist with running reports and validating KPIsAssist with quarterly data enrichment requirementsBuild out standard reporting and dashboards in Salesforce and TableauProvide general support to the revenue operations teamOther duties as assigned

Competencies
Assertiveness Time ManagementSelf-Motivated Teamwork OrientedAbility to Multitask Presentation SkillsAnalytical/Problem Solving Skills Organizational SkillsExperience working with Salesforce Experience working with Tableau is an asset

Qualifications:A Bachelor's Degree1-3 years of experience in operations, finance, or related field. Experience in maintaining and enhancing dataExperience in building reports and dashboard in SalesforceExperience with Tableau considered an assetExperience working in a face pace, complex environmentExperience with acquisition considered an asset
companyDescription:
Modern Campus is obsessed with empowering its 1,800+ higher education customers to thrive when radical transformation is required to respond to lower student enrollments and revenue, rising costs, crushing student debt and administrative complexity.   
  
The Modern Campus engagement platform powers solutions for non-traditional student management, web content management, catalog and curriculum management, student engagement & development, conversational text messaging, career pathways, and campus maps & virtual tours. The result: innovative institutions can create a Learner-to-Earner Lifecycle that engages modern learners for life, while providing modern administrators with the tools needed to streamline workflows and drive high efficiency.    
 
Delivering personalization, AI-driven recommendations and a modern e-commerce engine all purpose-built for the unique needs of higher ed, Modern Campus creates a student-first digital experience and removes silos across campus. Presidents and provosts, marketing and IT teams, admissions, registrars, student affairs and CE divisions can partner to attract, enroll, empower, retain, credential and re-engage students with pathways for lifelong learning.  
 
Learn more at moderncampus.com and follow us on LinkedIn.

jobDescription:

Use Power Query to extract data from different data sources and choose a storage mode and connectivity type.

jobDescription:
Requisition ID: 170660

Career Group: Corporate Office Careers

Job Category: Merchandising Analytics & Insights

Travel Requirements: 0 - 10%

 Job Type: Full-Time

Country: Canada (CA)

Province: Ontario; Alberta; Nova Scotia; Québec

City: Mississauga, Montreal, Calgary, Stellarton

Location: Tahoe Office, Calgary Office, Bureau de Montréal-Nord, Foord St. Office

Postal Code

Our family of 134,000 employees and franchise affiliates share a collective passion for delivering exceptional shopping experiences and amazing food to all our customers. Our mission is to nurture the things that make life better – great experiences, families, communities, and our employees. We are a family nurturing families.

A proudly Canadian company, we started in a small town in Nova Scotia but we are now in communities of all sizes across this great country. With over 1500 stores in all 10 provinces, you may know us as Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Thrifty Foods, Lawton’s Drug Stores or another of our great banners but we are all one extended family.

All career opportunities will be open a minimum of 5 business days from the date of posting.

We are looking for a Business Intelligence Specialist who will support our teams in the development and execution of strategies by providing vendor data and insights. You will also be involved in stakeholder communications and maintaining relationships with vendors.

We Are On a Journey To Completely Transform How We Do Business, And We Offer a Hybrid Work Model With The Opportunity To Work With
Leading tools and systemsA data-driven and customer-centric cultureStrong, collaborative team of energetic and experienced colleagues
What you’ll get to do in this fast-paced role: 

Business Intelligence Execution
Produce accurate reports and complete analysis to put forward suggestions to improve financial results, processes, and business improvementsProvide analytics for forward looking vendor metrics and provide insight to support and/or recommend a revised perspective on the various levers within Category Management Provide expertise and practical assistance in the ad hoc investigation, evaluation, and interpretation of data, themes and trendsContribute to sales and profitability of assigned categories through analysis and performance data of key vendorsAnalyze business and market trends to recommend new strategies for increased vendor performance Coordinate regular meetings with Category Managers in order to provide presentation level views of performance and strategy
Category
Collect and manage data ensuring data integrity for consumer, supplier, market, retail and geographic information for category management initiativesCreate reporting to track innovation and private label to maximize category performanceCreate reports that highlight inventory concerns and suggest corrective actions for close dated products and overstocksCreate complex models that assist in category performance analysis based on innovative views of dataUnderstand multifaceted approaches and statistical methodologies that will assist in category performance analysis
What You Should Bring To The Team
Undergraduate degree and at least 5 years experience in analytic roles Experience in retail or CPG environmentAdvanced communication and consulting capabilities, generated through many years of analyst and business experiencesHands-on expertise in Tableau, MS Excel, and MS PowerPointAbility to do complex modeling in Excel and design and execute complex SAS queriesStrong understanding of SQL and SAPAdvanced ability to integrate multiple data sources and identify the ‘so what’ associated with this effort for stakeholders
Sobeys is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process and will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of this process.

While all responses are appreciated only those being considered for interviews will be acknowledged.

We appreciate the interest from the Staffing industry however respectfully request no calls or unsolicited resumes from Agencies.
companyDescription:
As one of only two national grocery retailers in Canada, Sobeys Inc. serves the food shopping needs of Canadians with more than 1,500 stores in 10 provinces with retail banners that include Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Price Chopper, Thrifty Foods and Lawtons Drugs, as well as more than 330 retail fuel locations. Our five core retail food formats are designed to ensure that we have the right offering in the right-sized stores for each individual market we serve — from our full service format to the convenience format, each tailored to satisfy the unique occasion-based food shopping needs of our customers.

Our 134,000 employees and franchise affiliates are committed to building sustainable worth for each of our customers, employees, suppliers and shareholders through our focus on food, innovation and superior customer service.

__________________

En tant que l'un des deux seuls détaillants alimentaires présents dans tout le Canada, Sobeys Inc. répond aux besoins en épicerie de sa clientèle par le biais de ses quelque 1 500 magasins. Répartis dans chacune des dix provinces, ceux-ci arborent diverses bannières de détail dont Sobeys, Safeway, IGA, Foodland, FreshCo, Price Chopper, Thrifty Foods et Lawtons Drugs, ainsi que plus de 330 stations d'essence. Nos magasins d'alimentation sont conçus en fonction de cinq concepts de base afin que l'offre aux consommateurs et la taille des magasins conviennent le mieux à chacun des marchés que nous desservons. Du magasin à gamme complète de services jusqu'au dépanneur, chacun est adapté de façon à combler les besoins particuliers de notre clientèle en fonction de l'occasion d'achat.

En raison de l'importance qu'ils accordent à l'alimentation, à l'innovation et à l'excellence du service à la clientèle, nos quelque 125 000 employés et marchands affiliés se montrent soucieux de créer de la valeur de façon durable pour chacun de nos partenaires, qu'ils soient clients, employés, fournisseurs ou actionnaires.

jobDescription:
Are you looking for a supportive, collaborative workplace with great teams and inspiring leaders? You’ve come to the right place. We’re looking for ambitious people who share our values and want to make every day better for people around the world. If this sounds like you, and the career below sounds exciting, we’d like to hear from you.

Working Arrangement

Hybrid

Job Description

Do you have a passion for investigations and want to push your analytical skills and knowledge of the Canadian healthcare Industry to the next level? If so, Manulife’s Investigation Analyst, Provider Risk Management position might be for you.

The Opportunity

As one of Canada’s leading health and dental benefits providers, we are committed to improving our members’ health and well-being, while keeping costs down. Manulife’s Health and Dental Claims Risk Management department is focused on managing risk through preventing, detecting and investigating fraud and abuse, all in an effort to protect our benefit plans from risk. We are looking for a dynamic, risk minded individual to join our Investigation Services team.

Reporting to the Sr. Program Manager, Investigation Services Risk Management, the Investigation Analyst is responsible for applying Group Benefits knowledge, attention to detail, problem solving abilities, customer service and data analysis skills with the goal of investigating and preventing provider fraud and abuse. This role is focused on investigating and managing provider risk which involves conducting investigations through to completion. The successful candidate must thrive in a busy, fast paced environment while juggling multiple priorities at any given time.

What You’ll Do
Perform risk-based data profiling and analysis to identify outliers requiring further investigation Support audit programs; coordinating, assessing, and making decisions on investigations including the identification of high-risk providers and suspicious transactions through fraud data analytics addressing existing, new and emerging riskTake initiative and lead investigations to successful conclusion Conduct interviews of plan members, providers of service and others Prepare and file regulatory complaintsSupport investigators with the preparation of criminal complaints for submissionCreate written audits and other correspondence to plan members, providers of service and othersIdentify fraud trends and offer solutions to mitigate new, key risk indicatorsTrain and educate internal and external parties on ways to manage risk through fraud preventionEngage, interact and consult with various internal contacts such as Customer Service, Legal, Client Relations, Medical Consultants, Regional Group Office and external customers such as Health Practitioner Regulatory Bodies, Colleges and Associations, and Plan Sponsors Lead and support key investigative projects
What We Are Looking For
University degree or equivalent work experienceKnowledge of Group BenefitsKnowledge of fraud and abuse risk and techniques to manage risk Strong research, problem solving and decision-making skills Previous investigation experience (within the Health and Dental insurance industry is an asset)Effective case management including clear documentation of evidence and case findingsAbility to manage contentious interactions with various stakeholders Excellent oral and written communication skills Data analysis skills including advanced knowledge of Microsoft ExcelDemonstrated investigation experience with attention to detail Knowledge and understanding of contractual language, administration guidelines and provincial and federal legislation as it applies to the Canadian healthcare environmentAbility to be critical and aggressive in managing audit and investigative activitiesOrganizational skills with the ability to manage multiple, conflicting priorities
What can we offer you?
A competitive salary and benefits packages.A growth trajectory that extends upward and outward, encouraging you to follow your passions and learn new skills.A focus on growing your career path with us.Flexible work policies and strong work-life balance.Professional development and leadership opportunities.
Our commitment to you
Values-first culture We lead with our Values every day and bring them to life together.Boundless opportunity We create opportunities to learn and grow at every stage of your career.Continuous innovation We invite you to help redefine the future of financial services.Delivering the promise of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion We foster an inclusive workplace where everyone thrives.Championing Corporate Citizenship We build a business that benefits all partners and has a positive social and environmental impact.
Every career at Manulife/John Hancock provides the opportunity to learn new skills and move your career forward. Ready to make an impact somewhere? What are you waiting for? Apply today.

About John Hancock And Manulife

John Hancock is a unit of Manulife Financial Corporation, a leading international financial services group that helps people make their decisions easier and lives better. We operate primarily as John Hancock in the United States, and Manulife globally, including Canada, Asia and Europe. We provide financial advice, insurance and wealth and asset management solutions for individuals, groups and institutions. Assets under management and administration by Manulife and its subsidiaries were CAD$1.3 trillion (US$1.1 trillion) as of June 30, 2021. Manulife Financial Corporation trades as MFC on the TSX, NYSE, and PSE, and under 945 on the SEHK. Manulife can be found at manulife.com.

One of the largest life insurers in the United States, John Hancock supports more than 10 million Americans with a broad range of financial products, including life insurance, annuities, investments, 401(k) plans, and education savings plans. Additional information about John Hancock may be found at johnhancock.com.

Manulife is an Equal Opportunity Employer

At Manulife/John Hancock, we embrace our diversity. We strive to attract, develop and retain a workforce that is as diverse as the customers we serve and to foster an inclusive work environment that embraces the strength of cultures and individuals. We are committed to fair recruitment, retention, advancement and compensation, and we administer all of our practices and programs without discrimination on the basis of race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, religion or religious beliefs, creed, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), sexual orientation, genetic characteristics, veteran status, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, family status, disability, or any other ground protected by applicable law.

It is our priority to remove barriers to provide equal access to employment. A Human Resources representative will work with applicants who request a reasonable accommodation during the application process. All information shared during the accommodation request process will be stored and used in a manner that is consistent with applicable laws and Manulife/John Hancock policies. To request a reasonable accommodation in the application process, contact recruitment@manulife.com.

With our global headquarters in Toronto, we operate as Manulife across our offices in Canada, Asia, and Europe, and primarily as John Hancock in the United States. We have more than 38,000 employees, over 115,000 agents serving ~33 million customers worldwide, and over $1.3 trillion in assets under management and administration.

jobDescription:
Who We Are

Moneris was created as a joint investment between RBC and BMO Bank of Montreal (including Harris Bank) in December 2000. By maintaining the tradition of security and strength of our parent banks, today we are Canada's #1 processor, and one of North America's largest.

We are re-imagining commerce and shaping the future of FinTech. To do that, we empower our teams to redefine what's possible, enable them with the right tools and resources, and support them every step of the way.

Connect. Impact. Grow.

Join one of Canada's top employers and make your mark at Moneris.

What You'll Do

Implementation and maintenance of the underlying processes and systems supporting the automated provisioning of machine identities which include servers, network infrastructure, web services, applications, workstations, and the IoT.

What You Bring
Maintenance and support of Enterprise Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) and Certificate Lifecycle Management (CLM) systems which include Certificate Authorities, Registration Authorities, CRL/OCSP Responders, Automation Services and Tools, and Hardware Security Modules (HSMs)Maintaining documentation as it relates to procedures, configurations, topologies, and service records involving maintenance and support of PKI and CLM systems with attention to physical access, dual-control, and split knowledgeFacilitating and documenting key loading and key exchange activities using non-electronic methods and ensuring proper records are kept for audit purposes.Working with external certificate authorities such as Entrust, DigiCert, American Express, Mastercard, and Visa to establish secure network connectivityWorking with various teams and providing guidance on the use of X.509 fields to implement certificate profiles and enrollment automation using protocols such as ACME, CMP, EST, SCEP, and REST based web servicesGrowing and sharing knowledge within the organization to socialize and promote best practices in the proper implementation of cryptography wherever it is used for authentication, digital signatures, key management, and data protection in alignment with NIST and PCI standards

Must-have Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and/or related business experience5+ years Systems Admin experience (exposure to security concepts)

Nice-to-have Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Experience working on hand held crypto devices is an assetNetworking skills assetPKI experience is an asset

What You Get
The chance to be part of one of Canada’s top employers and leader in FinTechCompetitive pay and annual bonus program based on individual performance and productivityEmphasis on Wellness - Meeting Free Fridays (MF2), company-wide holiday closure, just to name a fewRRSP matching & defined contribution pension plan Flexible benefits package starting from day 1 Thrive in a Hybrid or Remote Model - including a tech peripheral rebate!Extensive learning & development programs and resources - plus unlimited free access to LinkedIn Learning and Udemy courses! Lots of opportunities to advance your career – 30% of Moneris' roles are filled internallyEAP (Employee Assistance Program), Educational Assistance and Recognition ProgramEmployee perk program with incredible discounts for over 2,400 vendors!Get involved in one or many of our Moneris Committees and Employee Resource Groups - Inclusive Workplace Council (IWC), Black Employee Network, just to name a few

Who You'll Work With

Our Technology team's goal is to connect ideas and technology to create solutions that shape the way people pay. Connection is in our DNA, and we are a team enabling our merchants, business partners, and each other with the tools we need to thrive. We're a team of over 400+ people, broken into six functions, who oversee all technology aspects at Moneris, including software, infrastructure engineering, cyber security, data analytics, and project management.

Learn more about how Moneris is striving to be at the forefront of Fintech!

Note: We welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, people of colour, people with disabilities, people of all genders, sexual orientation and intersectional identities.

Every day, we empower our team members to redefine what's possible in making an impact, creating growth opportunities, and making connections with our customers and each other. 

We're looking for out-of-the-box thinkers who want to join us in shaping the future of FinTech. Explore the careers hub page on our website to find an opportunity that's the right fit for you. https://moneris.com/careers

jobDescription:
L'Affichage en Francais suit celui en Anglais. Merci
Aftermarket Parts Forecast Analyst
Welcome to MHIRJ!
At MHIRJ, we value our people, inspiring them to excel and deliver positive results for all our partners in an environment that fosters and celebrates growth, collaboration, creativity, and different perspectives.
Our motivation
As a global leader in aviation, our world-class services are the backbone of airline fleets worldwide. We enable, grow, and sustain powerful connections between our customers, our people and our communities, delivering the resources and insights they need to take flight.
Our offer
We offer comprehensive operational engineering and customer support solutions including maintenance, refurbishment, technical publications, marketing and sales activities for the global regional aircraft industry.
Our headquarter is based in Boisbriand, Québec, and we are also positioned in important aviation hubs in the U.S., Canada and Germany.
Your contribution
We are looking for a Senior Aftermarket Parts Forecast Analyst with bold ideas that deliver value to our partners and advance our industry. By joining MHIRJ, you will work with a flexible, dynamic and united team.
In Your Role, You Will
 Support the implementation of the new planning and forecasting function and participate in the process development  Actively participate and supply expertise during the new planning/forecasting software implementation  Set-up and execute monthly inventory plan review  Develop forecasting methodology based on consumption history but also on upcoming maintenance events, reliability and customer’s flying hours  Monitor material availability against establish goals by location and drive corrective action where required  Review spare parts sales trends finding demand impacting negatively the results. Develop statistical models issuing recommendations to improve Off The Shelves (OTS) results and controlling inventory stock  Support reporting improvement and governance activities  Organize a structured methodology to help managing excess and obsolete inventory and support development and follow-up of an action plan  Analyze and present business case justifying non-budgeted inventory level increase  Act as a leader and a coach for the planning/forecasting team members supporting HR development 
Key Qualifications
As our ideal candidate,
 You possess a University degree in Business Management, Supply Chain or Engineering with a minimum of 3 years of relevant experience.  Demonstrated experience and knowledge of planning/forecasting and inventory management is needed.  You have demonstrated experience in business analysis, identifying trends and insights: overall governance  Experience in Aftermarket parts (Aircraft, Automotive) preferably Aerospace would be considered an asset  APICS certification, Six Sigma experience, project management training, and CPIM certification are considered valuable assets for this role.  You have strong analytical skills and business acumen  You are a team player with a strong sense of initiative, responsibility and good judgment  You are able to manage several concurrent projects and meet tight deadlines  You think quickly and creatively in a fast-moving and changing business context  You have excellent communication, presentation and interpersonal skills (French and English)  You are proficient with Windows applications at an advanced level in MS Office Suite  Knowledge and/or experience working with SAP would be an asset 
Analyste sénior planification pièces marché après-vente
Bienvenue chez MHIRJ !
Chez MHIRJ, nous reconnaissons la valeur de nos gens, et souhaitons les inspirer à exceller et à produire des résultats positifs pour l’ensemble de nos partenaires. Nous offrons un milieu de travail qui favorise et célèbre la croissance, la collaboration, la créativité et la diversité des perspectives.
Notre motivation
À titre de chef de file international de l’aviation, nous proposons des services de qualité supérieure qui propulsent de nombreuses flottes aériennes à l’échelle mondiale. Nous établissons, développons et entretenons des liens puissants entre nos clients, nos employés et les collectivités en leur offrant les ressources et l’expertise nécessaires pour prendre leur envol.
Notre offre
Nous offrons des solutions complètes en matière d'exploitation, d'ingénierie et de soutien à la clientèle y compris la maintenance, la remise à neuf, les publications techniques, le marketing et les activités de vente pour l'industrie mondiale des avions régionaux. Notre siège social est basé à Boisbriand, Québec et nous sommes également positionnés dans d'importantes plaques tournantes de l'aviation aux États-Unis, au Canada et en Allemagne.
Votre apport
Nous sommes à la recherche d’un (une) Analyste sénior planification pièces marché après-vente aux idées audacieuses qui offrent de la valeur à nos partenaires et font progresser notre industrie. En vous joignant à MHIRJ, vous collaborerez avec une équipe flexible, dynamique et unie.
Dans le cadre de votre poste, vous serez appelé à :
 Supporter l’implantation d’une nouvelle fonction de prévision et planification en participant au développement des processus  Participer activement et fournir l’expertise lors de l’implantation d’un nouveau logiciel de prévision et planification  Préparer et exécuter le processus de révision mensuel du plan d’inventaire  Développer une méthodologie de prévision basé sur l’historique de consommation mais également sur les activités de maintenance à venir, la fiabilité et les heures de vol prévus  Gérer la disponibilité du matériel en fonction des objectifs établis par localisation et mener a bien les actions correctives entamées  Gérer le développement et l’implantation d’outil systémique requis par l’équipe afin d’améliorer l’efficacité et d’efficience des processus de prévision et les tours d’inventaire  Mener des projets d’amélioration continue afin d’augmenter la performance des processus exécuté par l’équipe  Réviser les tendances de ventes des pièces de marché après-vente, rechercher les causes de la demande, développer des modèles de prévision statistique afin de recommander aux gestionnaires des moyens d’améliorer le résultat du ``Off The Shelves’’ (OTS) ainsi que le plan d’inventaire  Supporter l’amélioration des rapports de gouvernance périodique  Encadrer le développement d’initiatives de gestion de l’inventaire inactif ou en excès par l’analyse causale, le développement de plan d’action et le suivi de projet  Analyser et mettre en place des plans d’affaire justifiant des augmentations d’inventaire non budgétée  Être un ‘’leader’’ et un ‘’coach’’ pour les membres de l’équipe en supportant le développement de chacun d’eux. 
Compétences Clés
 Vous possédez un diplôme universitaire en administration des affaires, gestion des opérations ou en ingénierie, avec un minimum de (5) années d'expérience pertinente. La connaissance des concepts de planification et de gestion du stock est obligatoire.  Vous démontrez de l’expérience en analyse de données et gouvernance de processus.  Idéalement, vous avez acquis une expérience pertinente en amélioration continue, gestion de projet et/ou une certification de type CPIM. Expérience Six Sigma et formation en gestion de projet sont considérés également comme des atouts pour ce rôle.  Vous possédez des compétences supérieures avec l’application des outils de la suite Office.  Vous démontrez un bon jugement ainsi qu’une capacité d’adaptation à un environnement de travail dynamique comprenant souvent plusieurs priorités en compétition.  De l’expérience dans le service après-vente du secteur manufacturier préférablement en aéronautique ou automobile sera considéré comme un atout. Comme atout, bonne connaissance de l’environnement d’affaire des pièces de rechange en Aéronautique couplé d’une bonne appréciation des pratiques, contraintes et processus liés à l’industrie.  Vous avez un fort sens organisationnel ainsi que de gestion du temps vous amenant à rencontrer les objectifs à temps, de façon constante.  Vous êtes en mesure de pouvoir gérer plusieurs projets à la fois et de respecter des délais serrés  Vous possédez d’excellente aptitude de communication (Français et Anglais), de présentation et démontrez de l’entregent  Connaissance et/ou expérience de travail dans SAP sera considéré comme un atout.

jobDescription:
ABOUT CORPAYCorpay is part of the FLEETCOR (NYSE: FLT) portfolio of brands. A payments leader serving customers across the globe. Powering the next generation of payments. We enable businesses to spend less through smarter payment methods. Our solutions are backed by a strong balance sheet, secure infrastructure, and best-in-class customer support. Handling over a billion payment transactions across 145+ currencies in over 100 countries. Today, business is moving at an accelerated pace. Automation is the norm and digital connectivity is the goal. For many businesses, this speed creates complexity and their current payment processes can’t keep up. We help businesses, big and small, transition from older payment methods to smarter ones. ROLE FUNCTION AND PURPOSE  The Business Intelligence Analyst works closely with the business and senior management and is a major contributor to the reporting deliverables, including budgeting, forecasting, modeling, and analysis, documenting business process, and preparing presentations on highlights, lowlights, business risks and opportunities. The need to comprehend business concepts and ensures these concepts are delivered as meaningful analytics. The analyst facilitates concept gathering and assists in the creation of new reports or analytics. Additionally, the analyst should be experienced with problem-solving and conflict resolution to help identify, communicate and resolve issues.
 KEY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  The primary purpose of this position is to support the Manager, Business Intelligence and Senior Management in terms of financial business analysis and sales performance analysis with a view to deliver enhanced business performance. Assist in preparing Annual Revenue Budget – Management presentations, Global, Regional and Sales Revenue budgets at the detailed level also setting up sales individual’s targets and portfolio allocations.Assist in preparing regular Revenue Forecasts – Quarterly, monthly and Flash Forecasts Support distribution of accurate and timely Financial and Business reports that enhance the decision-making abilities for the Senior Management and Executives.Perform in depth revenue analysis and commentary on key variances vs. targets and vs. prior months/years and recommendations for future action as required.Support monthly operational reporting and collaborate with stakeholders to determine key regional highlights, lowlights and accomplishments for review and discussion at the weekly/monthly management meeting with Regional VPs.Evaluate and report on risk adjusted revenue to identify risks and opportunities with respect to business performance.Prepare modeling to assess ROI & also conduct due diligence for new partnerships evaluation.Prepare and update regular client profitability analysisSupport modelling, analysis, tracking and reporting of sales incentives programsIdentify and recommend improvements to current processes, with a focus on increased efficiencies and enhanced value-added analytics.Introduce new analysis, reporting formats, etc. which provide insights to different areas of the business.Provide support on variety of integration and other business projects central to improving internal processes.Maintain BI Documentation for all processes
 EXPERIENCE AND KEY SKILLS1-2 Years’ Experience in Financial Planning and Business AnalysisBusiness Intelligence tool(s) (e.g., Tableau, Power BI – Business User for analytics & not a developer)Microsoft Office- Excel, Word, Visio, and PowerPointMicrosoft SQL, VBA / Macros (not a requirement)Basic Knowledge on CRM (Salesforce)
 ABILITIES AND ATTRIBUTESProven ability to conduct and/or support multiple projects with minimal oversightStrong communication and listening skills to elicit detailed requirementsProven analytical skills in defining business needs for reporting requirementsDemonstrable excellent written and verbal communication skills with business and technical stakeholders as well as internal and external usersStrong attention to detail and accuracyAbility to work independently and to prioritize work with a focus on deadlines and deliverablesProven record as a strong team player in a fast-paced, deadline driven, diverse environmentExceptional interpersonal skills


#INDINT

Apply Now

companyDescription:
At Allstate, we work everyday toward fostering safe, secure communities by providing Canadians with unique prevention and protection services.

Life is uncertain. So, we empower and protect customers, employees and communities in Canada with strength, experience and care. This is our purpose; it’s why we exist as a company.

Insurance plays an important role in Canada. We help customers protect the people and things that matter most in their lives with our insurance products or through business partners with a complementary offering. We have a network of agents who can help customers in many different languages, but also live and work in the communities they serve. It’s this approach that makes us a different company.

We believe our employees are our greatest strength, so we strive to create an environment for people to flourish by focusing on wellness, collaboration, contribution and growth – both for the company and for their career. In fact, our corporate culture is one of our strongest assets and a key differentiator for us as an employer.

If you’re looking for meaningful work supporting an essential service provided by a company that’s experiencing strong growth amid a corporate environment that’s inclusive, supportive, flexible and helpful, we might have a role for you.

What we’re looking for
We often hire new employees for fit and mindset, rather than depth of experience in the insurance sector. Of course, for some roles, relevant experience or certification may be required. However, we can teach people what they need to be successful, because we’re really looking for those with a drive to help others succeed.

That means we’re looking for team players, innovators, business builders and community-minded individuals that see an opportunity in our sector... and with Allstate. 

Does that sound like you?
If so, we’d love to hear from you. 

If you’d like to learn more about us first, find us on Facebook and Instagram under @AllstateCanada.

Hiring for a 4 month internship starting January 2023*
Canadian Pacific is a transcontinental railway in Canada and the United States with direct links to major ports on the west and east coasts, providing North American customers a competitive rail service with access to key markets in every corner of the globe. CP is growing with its customers, offering a suite of freight transportation services, logistics solutions and supply chain expertise. Visit cpr.ca to see the rail advantages of CP.
PURPOSE OF THE POSITION
CP is looking for a Data Analyst student to fill temporary positions for broken rail detection within the operations technology team . We will expose interns to various engineering systems and project management stages to learn various aspects of the railway business. You will be part of an engineering team that aims to increase rail safety through implementation and improvements of detectors that monitor rail integrity.
Position Accountabilities
 Work through different stages of project management from planning, to procurement, field installations, monitoring  Work with project stakeholders  Recommend procedures for the system reliability enhancements based on system failure analysis  Develop rules for alerts based on detector signal responses  Improve existing processes and reporting through value-added analysis 
Position Requirements
 Data Science or Engineering Discipline in Electrical Engineering. Mechanical, Industrial, and Project Management backgrounds will be considered;  Strong problem solving skills and decision making skills;  Strong data analysis experience required;  Must be proficient with MS Excel and a programming language for data analytics such as python, R, etc.  Must be able to identify, analyze and interpret schema, trends, or patterns in complex data.  Experience with SAP would be an asset;  Excellent verbal and communication skills;  Strong leadership and technical skills;  Must have valid driver’s license;  Traveling (30%) is required for this position. Full expenses are covered including flights, meals, hotels and rental cars.  Canadian or US Citizen and able to travel / work in both Canada and the US

The successful candidate will need to successfully complete the following clearances:
 Criminal history check  Reference check

jobDescription:

We’re proud to help our clients and communities adapt and thrive in a world of constant change.
Our promise to you: It’s better here. Why? Because we CARE, and we provide an employee experience that’s collaborative, ambitious, rewarding, and empowering.
Our ambition is to be one of Canada’s leading and most innovative P&C insurers. Come be a part of our journey, and love what you do.
Definity offers a flexible, hybrid work experience where employees work from the office and virtually depending on the type of work they are doing and who they are working with. Leader’s partner with their teams to find the right balance of on-site and remote work that best meets the needs of their teams, colleagues, brokers and customers, while ensuring collaboration, teamwork and accountability for goals.
What can you expect in this role?

companyDescription:
Definity invests in multi-channel operations to provide our fellow Canadians with optimal insurance coverage options for their homes, vehicles, farms, pets, and businesses.

We’re proudly Canadian, and we offer a range of responsive, service-backed insurance solutions for customers from coast to coast. Definity has deep roots, dating all the way back to November 25, 1871, when our founding brand, the Economical Mutual Fire Insurance Company, issued its first policy to protect Ismael D. Bowman’s barn and home. Today, Definity continues the tradition of providing Canadians with great service, whether that’s through a licensed broker or through our digital direct channels.

Economical Insurance

Petline Insurance

jobDescription:
For 70 years, Charles River employees have worked together to assist in the discovery, development and safe manufacture of new drug therapies. When you join our family, you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. Whether your background is in life sciences, finance, IT, sales or another area, your skills will play an important role in the work we perform. In return, we’ll help you build a career that you can feel passionate about.

IMPORTANT:  In order to be considered for this position, a resume/CV must be uploaded and submitted during the application process. Please make sure work history and education are added correctly.

We are currently seeking to hire an Analyst for our Biomarkers team located in Senneville (West of Montreal).

How will you create an impact?

The Biomarkers department analyzes biological characteristics used for evaluating the progression of a disease, normal biological processes, and pharmacological reactions to the drug or a mechanism of action. Our scientific expertise is varied and covers key toxicological indications and a range of therapeutic areas, including oncology, inflammation, immunology, infectious disease, and disease of the cardiovascular, renal, respiratory, and central nervous systems.

Why Charles River? 

We offer an excellent integration program for our new employees as well as opportunities for internal growth and career development. Our other perks include:

As of Day 1:
Competitive benefits & we pay 90% of premiums (health and dental coverage). Access to a savings and retirement program with employer contribution. Vacation and Personal Day Policy. Free telemedicine app for you and your family. 

Transportation:
Shuttle service from the Sainte-Anne-de Bellevue train station and from John Abbott College to the Senneville location. Free parking. 

Work Schedule & Salary:
Starting salary rate of $19.50/HR. Permanent, full-time position from Monday to Friday. 

What will you work on?

Working in our newly renovated laboratories, you will perform sample analysis work using various immunoassays and enzymatic assays, such as ELISA, Luminex, Radioimmunoassay (RIA), ECL, SMC Technology, Simoa Technology, and Simple Protein ELLA. You will also perform method development, validation, and conduct data analysis to determine if results are within expectations; all in accordance with Good Laboratory Practices (GLP).

Who are we looking for?

We are seeking a motivated individual with either a DEC in Science (Biotechnology, Medical Laboratory, or equivalent) or a BAC in Science (Immunology, Biology, Biochemistry) who works with precision and strives for quality work. A self-starter with a collaborative and positive attitude who can work under time constraints and adapt to changes. Must be comfortable working under English conditions, bilingualism is an asset.

If you are interested in contributing to the well-being of our communities, not only across the country but around the world, please join us and BE THE DIFFERENCE! 

IMPORTANT: A resume is required to be considered for this position. If you have not uploaded your resume in your candidate profile, please return to upload field and attach your resume/CV.

About Safety Assessment

Charles River is committed to helping our partners expedite their preclinical drug development with exceptional safety assessment services, state-of-the-art facilities and expert regulatory guidance. From individual specialty toxicology and IND enabling studies to tailored packages and total laboratory support, our deeply experienced team can design and execute programs that anticipate challenges and avoid roadblocks for a smooth, efficient journey to market. Each year approximately 120 investigational new drug (IND) programs are conducted in our Safety Assessment facilities.

About Charles River

Charles River is an early-stage contract research organization (CRO). We have built upon our foundation of laboratory animal medicine and science to develop a diverse portfolio of discovery and safety assessment services, both Good Laboratory Practice (GLP) and non-GLP, to support clients from target identification through preclinical development. Charles River also provides a suite of products and services to support our clients’ clinical laboratory testing needs and manufacturing activities. Utilizing this broad portfolio of products and services enables our clients to create a more flexible drug development model, which reduces their costs, enhances their productivity and effectiveness to increase speed to market.

With over 17,000 employees within 90 facilities in 20 countries around the globe, we are strategically positioned to coordinate worldwide resources and apply multidisciplinary perspectives in resolving our client’s unique challenges. Our client base includes global pharmaceutical companies, biotechnology companies, government agencies and hospitals and academic institutions around the world. And in 2019, revenue increased to $2.62 billion.

At Charles River, we are passionate about our role in improving the quality of people’s lives. Our mission, our excellent science and our strong sense of purpose guide us in all that we do, and we approach each day with the knowledge that our work helps to improve the health and well-being of many across the globe. We have proudly supported the development of ~85% of the drugs approved by the FDA in 2019.

Equal Employment Opportunity

Charles River Laboratories is an Equal Opportunity Employer - all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

If you are interested in applying to Charles River Laboratories and need special assistance or an accommodation due to a disability to complete any forms or to otherwise participate in the resume submission process, please contact a member of our Human Resources team by sending an e-mail message to crrecruitment_US@crl.com. This contact is for accommodation requests for individuals with disabilities only and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

For more information, please visit www.criver.com.

jobDescription:
Pour répondre à un fort accroissement de la demande de ses clients, Menya, la division IA de Levio, recherche de nouveaux collaborateurs désireux de s'investir dans des projets d'intelligence d'affaires touchant les secteurs financiers, le marketing, l'assurances, les chaînes d'approvisionnement, l'industrie 4.0 et encore bien d'autres sujets passionnants !

Vous allez collaborer avec les directeurs scientifiques, les experts des domaines d'affaires ainsi que les membres de l'équipe de développement pour élaborer des solutions BI qui répondent à des besoins d'affaires concrets. Vous serez au cœur de la livraison de solutions utilisant les outils BI 3.0 tels que la virtualisation des données, l'accès aux données en temps réel, DWaaS, BI libre-service, Lac de données, etc.

RÔLE ET RESPONSABILITÉS :

Dans le cadre des projets 
En lien direct avec les utilisateurs et les gestionnaires de produit, définir la problématique d'affaires et décrire les objectifs recherchés en termes d'intelligence d'affaires et de mise en valeur des données ;Produire des documents d'architecture BI tel que : architecture de données, architecture de solutions et architecture logicielle ;Réaliser des synthèses exécutives à destination des comités de gestion ; Assurer un transfert de connaissances et un soutien auprès des développeurs tout au long du projet ;Mettre en place les indicateurs de suivi des différents modèles déployés en production et proposer les ajustements pour en améliorer l'efficacité ;Élaboration et rédaction des stratégies de réalisation, d'intégration, d'essais et de déploiement des solutions BI ;Recommander les solutions appropriées et déterminer les applications/orientations BI qui seront utilisées dans les solutions retenues. 

En parallèle des projets
Contribuer à l'adaptation des compétences et technologies BI de Menya et Levio ;Assurer un rôle de vigie afin de comprendre et d'anticiper les tendances ayant cours en BI et effectuer des recommandations appropriées. 

QUALIFICATIONS ET EXPÉRIENCE : 
Cumuler au moins 5 ans d'expérience en projets d'intelligence d'affaires; Détenir un baccalauréat en analytique d'affaires, mathématique, informatique ou domaine connexe ;Posséder des connaissances sur l'état de l'art des offres de services infonuagiques en BI ; Avoir de l'expérience avec la méthodologie Agile ;Maîtriser les concepts d'intelligence d'affaires ainsi que les concepts d'analytique avancée ; Posséder la maîtrise des concepts de la gestion des données, de l'échange et de l'intégration des données (ETL et temps réel) et des techniques de développement de bases de données informationnelles ;Démontrer du leadership, de l'autonomie, de la polyvalence, esprit de synthèse, axé sur les décisions et les résultats. 

Considérer comme un atout:
Expérience dans le développement de modèles d'intelligence artificielle ;Avoir déjà déployé des solutions BI dans des environnements type AWS, Azure ou GCP ;Connaissance des environnements de gestion de données maîtresses et de référence ;Connaissance des technologies suivantes : Big Data, Databricks, Outil de visualisation de données (Tableau, Qlik, Google Data Studio, Power BI) et virtualisation de données (Tibco, Denodo). 

AVANTAGES SOCIAUX :

Levio offre plusieurs avantages dans le but d'offrir la plus grande flexibilité possible à ses employés! En plus d'offrir un environnement de travail stimulant et dynamique, nous offrons entre autres :
Des assurances collectivesRégime enregistré d'épargne-retraite (REER)Une allocation pour le développement professionnel de 2500$Le transport en commun ou le stationnement est payéDes primes au référencementUn club social actif

Statut du poste : Temps plein, 37,5h/semaine

Levio souscrit au principe d'équité en emploi et applique un programme d'accès à l'égalité en emploi pour les femmes, les autochtones, les minorités visibles, les minorités ethniques et les personnes handicapées.

Le genre masculin est utilisé sans aucune discrimination et dans le seul but d'alléger le présent texte.
companyDescription:

In fact, our reputation on the market is the result of the personality of the men and women who make up our team, their engagement and their exceptional expertise.

The driving force of our organization is our desire to deliver solutions which take full advantage of new technologies in order to help our clients gain in efficiency and in profitability.

jobDescription:
Product Analyst Gaming $100,000 - 110,000 CAD+ EquityCanada - Remote
A hyper-growth startup within the Gaming domain is in the market for a technically savvy Product Analytics professional to join their team. If you are hands-on and can ultimately communicate trend analysis to both technical and non-technical audiences, then this can be the move for you!
THE ROLE– Product Analyst In this capacity, you will be responsible for facilitating product data initiatives for an organization that is analytically driven from the top down. You will utilize best-of-breed statistical and visualization tools to inform key decisions across the business; the ideal candidate will have ample experience leveraging the aforementioned tools to ultimately generate product insights that will ultimately benefit the greater business as a whole.
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field. Master's preferred.Experience within a gaming or tech. domain strongly preferred.Previous experience in a Product Analytics capacity is needed.Strong proficiency with SQL is required. Exposure to open-source statistical languages such as Python or R is strongly preferred.Deep understanding of using raw data to draw insights.Great communication skills and the ability to work with stakeholders cross-functionally.Ample experience utilizing BI tools for story-telling purposes, including Tableau, PowerBI, Domo, Looker, etc.
BENEFITS – Product Analyst As a Product Analyst, you can expect to earn up to $110,000 (depending on experience) + highly competitive benefits and equity.
HOW TO APPLY?:Please register your interest by sending your Resume to Greffen George via the Apply link on this page
KEYWORDS:SQL, Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, Stakeholder Management, Story-Telling, User Requirements, Gaming, Games, Product, Python, R, Product Analytics, Stakeholder Management, Product Features
companyDescription:
Established in 2006, Harnham were founded as a specialist recruitment business for the Data & Analytics market. Over the past 15 years, we’ve grown into the global leader in Data & Analytics recruitment with over 200 consultants, covering permanent and contract vacancies across the UK, Europe, and USA, and winning several awards along the way. 

Our unique networking style has meant that we’ve established a client and candidate base built on trust, focus, and efficiency. As a result of this, our clients have given us a Net Promoter Score (NPS) of 83, whilst our candidates have given us 88, both far above industry averages.

Specialising in roles throughout Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Digital Analytics, Life Science Analytics, Data & Technology, Data Engineering, Risk Analytics and Computer Vision we support candidates and businesses working in what we believe to be the world's most innovative and exciting industry.
